question: [File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Logic error] Can the comparison in_progress_queue.len() < *this.max at line 59 be off-by-one, allowing max+1 futures to be in progress? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [State invariant] Is the invariant that in_progress_queue.len() <= max always maintained, or can concurrent operations violate this during backup processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Termination condition] At line 75, can this.stream.is_done() return true while in_progress_queue is non-empty, causing premature termination? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Liveness guarantee] If both stream and in_progress_queue are non-empty but all return Poll::Pending, is forward progress guaranteed or can deadlock occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Module dependency] [Circular wakeup] Can the interaction between TryBufferedX's waker registration and FuturesOrderedX's waker create circular dependencies that prevent task wake-up? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Module dependency] [Error translation] When errors propagate from FuturesOrderedX through TryBufferedX, can error context be lost, making backup failures undebuggable? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [Stream composition] When TryBufferedX is chained with other stream combinators in backup-cli, can backpressure signals be lost, causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: new()] [Zero buffer size] If n=0 is passed to new(), does the while loop condition at line 59 prevent any futures from being spawned, causing immediate termination? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: new()] [Max buffer size] If n=usize::MAX, can the length check at line 59 overflow when adding to in_progress_queue.len(), causing incorrect buffer management? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Empty stream] If the input stream is immediately empty (returns Poll::Ready(None)), does poll_next correctly return Poll::Ready(None) without hanging? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Single item stream] For a stream with exactly one item, can race conditions cause it to be processed twice or skipped entirely? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Busy loop] Can a malicious backup file cause the while loop at line 59 to execute millions of times in a single poll_next call, causing validator CPU exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Stack overflow] Can deep recursion in the polling logic cause stack overflow when processing deeply nested backup structures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Struct: TryBufferedX] [Heap fragmentation] Can the pattern of allocating and deallocating futures in in_progress_queue cause severe heap fragmentation over long backup operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [Checksum bypass] Can TryBufferedX's concurrent processing cause backup chunks to be written without checksum verification, allowing corrupted data into the database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [Duplicate processing] Can the same backup chunk be processed multiple times through TryBufferedX due to retry logic, causing duplicate transaction insertion and state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [Atomic commit] When multiple futures complete simultaneously in in_progress_queue, are their results atomically committed to storage, or can partial commits create inconsistent state? (Critical)
